title: ARISTAIOS
content:
ARISTAIOS (Aristaeus) was the only one of the Gigantes (Giants) to survive their war against the gods. He fled
        to the island of Sikelia (Sicily) where his mother Gaia (the Earth) transformed him into a dung-beetle.

He was perhaps identified with the deity Aristaios who was sometimes
        described as a Titan- or giant-son of Ouranos.

Suidas s.v. Aristaios (trans. Suda On Line) (Byzantine Greek Lexicon C10th A.D.)
          :
        "Aristaios (Aristaeus) : One of the Gigantes (Giants), who survived . . . Aristaios, the story goes, was
        the only Gigante to survive, on the Sikelion (Sicilian) mountain called Aitne (Etna); the fire of heaven did not
        reach him, and nor did Aitne harm him."

Suidas s.v. Aitnaios kantharos (trans. Suda On Line) (Byzantine Greek Lexicon C10th
          A.D.) :
        "Aitnaios kantharos (Dung-beetle of Etna) : The big [kind]. Because the mountain [is] also big.
        They say that Aristaios (Aristaeus) was the only Gigante (Giant) to survive; the fire of heaven did not reach
        him, nor did Aitna (Etna) harm him."
